meanings.definition: A direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal or issue.
meanings.sent1: The referenda allowed the people to decide on the new law.
meanings.sent2: The city held a referendum to determine the fate of the new park.
meanings.sent3: During the referendum, everyone got to have their say.
meanings.sent4: The referendum was a clear reflection of the community's wishes.
meanings.sent5: The referendum outcome was eagerly anticipated by all.

meanings.definition: The process of referring a matter for decision or consideration.
meanings.sent1: The referenda of important matters ensured thorough discussion.
meanings.sent2: The referenda of complex issues required careful deliberation.
meanings.sent3: The referenda process was surprisingly efficient.
meanings.sent5: The referenda process was a model of transparency.
